alert.note: Alert for Bamberg; Central Orangeburg; Southeastern Orangeburg (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 05 at 6:27PM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Bamberg and south central Orangeburg Counties through 715 PM EDT... At 627 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Branchville, or 12 miles southeast of Bamberg, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Orangeburg, Bamberg, Branchville, Bowman, Rivers Bridge State Park, Ehrhardt, Rowesville, Olar, Govan and Yonder Field. This includes Interstate 26 between mile markers 152 and 164. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
